Issues.Title: fix(bazel): Read latest versions from latest-versions.ts & use semver‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ check

When @angular/bazel is installed, a postinstall script is run to make sure that
the npm version is *exactly* the same as the Angular repository install by
Bazel. This check is overly stringent. Instead, it should enforce that the
version satisfies the range check instead. This is consistent with the range
defined in angular-cli/packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts.

This commit also fixes the Bazel workspace to use the same Rxjs version if it's
already installed.

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
Currently, `ContentChildren` can only query into the template of the component where it is used. I would like it to be able to query into the templates of Angular components used in the top-level component's template.
See this example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-content-children-example

### Describe the solution you'd like
What I would like is to have `ContentChildren` be able to also query the templates of Angular components found in the top-level component's template. So in the example I linked, the `ContentChildren` query would search into the template for `ParentComponent` and find the 2 instances of the `ChildComponent`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I tried creating a workaround, but it was hacky and had errors that I couldn't fix.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@ContentChildren can't query into grandchild component template" (#27588)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): host bindings should work if input has same name
Issues.Body:
Previously in Ivy, host bindings did not work if they shared a public name
with an Input because they used the `elementProperty` instruction as is.
This instruction was originally built for inside component templates, so it
would either set a directive input OR a native property. This is the
correct behavior for inside a template, but for host bindings, we always
want the native properties to be set regardless of the presence of an Input.

This change adds an extra argument to `elementProperty` so we can tell it to
ignore directive inputs and only set native properties (if it is in the
context of a host binding).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): host bindings should work if input has same name" (#27589)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): proper slot allocation for pure functions in `hostBindings` function
Issues.Body:
Prior to this update, we always returned the number of host vars defined in @Component definition as a value for `allocatePureFunctionsSlot` callback in ValueConverter. As a result, pure function arguments were not accounted for, thus leasing to incorrect slot offsets in `pureFunction` calls. Now we update and return total # of host vars, so the offsets are defined correctly.

This PR resolves issue FW-817.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): attempting to remove detached view on destroy
Issues.Body:
Currently the `ViewRef.destroy` method assumes that its index inside the view container will always be valid, however if it has been removed already, it'll be -1 which will throw an error.

The error manifested itself in one of the unit tests where a view had been detached during the test and then `TestBed` attempted to destroy its `ComponentRef` which ended up throwing an `Error during cleanup of component`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): attempting to remove detached view on destroy" (#27585)

# bug report ### Affected Package This issue is most likely caused by @angular/common; could be @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? Don't know - I have not tested this issue in previous versions. I can repro it in the latest versions of angular: 7.1.0 ### Description Use case: Using dynamic components and modules in --prod builds fails as follows. Non-prod builds are fine. I have a pared-down repro site here: https://github.com/johncrim/angular-dynamic-styleguide It uses components that are compiled at runtime to display template markup next to working examples of the template markup. This is an @angular/cli created project. The `AppComponent` displays a sequence of 3 dynamically compiled components, which are all included in a single dynamically compiled module listed below. AppComponent renders fine in --prod mode when `CommonModule` is not imported by the dynamic module. When `CommonModule` is imported: ``` typescript const examplesModule = NgModule({ declarations: [components], exports: [...components], entryComponents: [components], imports: [MatIconModule] // works // BUGBUG: Adding CommonModule results in Error: Can't resolve all parameters for NgClass: (?, ?, ?, ?). //imports: [MatIconModule, CommonModule] })(class TemplateExamplesModule { }); ``` ... the below exception is thrown. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction git clone https://github.com/johncrim/angular-dynamic-styleguide yarn yarn start --prod (launch browser - works) In `template-examples.service.ts`, line 66, uncomment the `//imports: [MatIconModule, CommonModule]` line, and comment out the previous `imports:` line - error occurs. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: ngcc: support overloaded `ModuleWithProviders` functions
Issues.Body:
We now add in the type parameter for functions that return `ModuleWithParameter` structures.
But we ought to consider supporting the case where the function is overloaded.

See https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/27326#discussion_r240329636
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngcc: support overloaded `ModuleWithProviders` functions" (#27582)

Issues.Title: Provide some examples on Authentication and Authorization
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report
FYI, I've looked at #1067 and #1403. I feel that providing these examples would increase adoption of Angular.

There are tons of examples which cite using localStorage for implementing authentication and then there are examples which say that localStorage shouldn't be used and should be encrypted in a Cookie.

I haven't really bumped in to good Roles/Role Hierarchy/Authorization yet. I am coming from a traditional webapp development perspective with Java, Spring Boot, Spring Security. I've developed some AngularJS apps but implementing Authentication and Authorization in latest Angular is consuming significant amount of time.

Although this seems trivial but adding those example would essentially improve adoption of Angular. A significant amount of Apps require this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide some examples on Authentication and Authorization" (#27579)

Issues.Title: Improve Routes for allows input params to component
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request
It is essential that the way in which we share data between components in different routes is easier.

I think it is important to uncouple the component from the route to make it more reusable.

For that, we could use the Input() of the component, so that it works for the path and query params from route.

And use the router Link to pass data.

### Relevant Package
@angular/router

### Description
When you create modular components using the Input (), they can not be reused for use with the path, and use the path or query params. Since you must change the logic and work with the functions of Route that gives you angular.

I think it is necessary to achieve mainly:

-We can use the input to send data from the path (path or query params).
-Poder pass the data easily using a routerLink.


### Describe the solution you'd like
For example:

Component A: 
`
export class Component{
 @Input()
   user: string;

 @Input()
  text: string;
}
`

And Url would be:
/api/users/:user

if you want to pass this data:
`
data = {
  user: 'UserName',
  text: "A text"
}
`

you should be able to pass with routeLink:

`route.navigate(['api/users/:user'], data);`

This generates the correct path : 
/api/users/UserName?text=A%20text

And will be loaded in the two inputs of components automatically



### Describe alternatives you've considered
In any case, the most important thing is to be able to use the data that comes from a uri, in a transparent way to the component so that it is reusable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Improve Routes for allows input params to component" (#27576)

Issues.Title: Hosting an angular library outside the application module
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [x ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
Angular CLI: 7.1.2
Node: 8.11.3
OS: win32 x64

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.11.2
@angular-devkit/core         7.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics   7.1.2
@schematics/angular          7.1.2
@schematics/update           0.11.2
rxjs                         6.3.3
typescript                   3.1.6


### Repro steps
ng generate library "mylib"

### Desired functionality
Hi,

I want to create Angular libraries, while having the "container" app living in another "npm" module. I need to do this for module sharing purposes, for clear module separation concerns and because our app is already organized in that way.
This is the target architecture I'm trying to achieve : 
-> myApp (NPM module)
     ----> angular.json
     ----> src
     ----> package.json
-> myLib1 (another NPM module, not living inside myApp)
      ----> src
               ----> some .ts files
      ----> dist
      ----> package.json
-> myLib2 (yet another NPM module not living inside myApp)
     ----> src
              ----> some .ts files
     ----> dist
     ----> package.json

I cannot achieve this result by using CLI options or by setting "newProjectRoot" parameter to ".. " in myApp/angular.json for example.
I would like to avoid re-creating **for each library** an empty "app" container, that embeds a "projects" folder, itself contains a "library" folder, itself containing an "src" folder...
Since I'm using Yarn, I have a root-level "nodes_modules" folder containing symlinks pointing to myLib1 and myLib2, so I do not need to have everything "installed" in the same folder.

Do you see a solution with actual CLI tools for :
- having the bootstrapping app in one module
- having the library folder in another module, not inside the app
- avoiding recreating a folder scaffolding in each library ?

Thanks in advance ;)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hosting an angular library outside the application module" (#27573)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support injecting ChangeDetectorRef on templates
Issues.Body:
If a pipe is used in a binding of a structural directive's input, that pipe should be able to request the ChangeDetectorRef and be given the ref of the component that the template is part of. The async pipe depends on this, as it requires a ChangeDetectorRef. Previously, the following template would fail at runtime as the async pipe's request for ChangeDetectorRef would throw. ```
``` This commit changes to behavior to consider a container node as valid target for ChangeDetectorRef. ## PR Checklist Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements: - [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit - [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) - [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [x] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes - [ ] CI related changes - [ ] Documentation content changes - [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes - [ ] Other... Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support complex type nodes in ModuleWithProviders
Issues.Body:
With ngcc's ability to fixup pre-Ivy `ModuleWithProviders` such that they
include a reference to the NgModule type, the type may become a qualified
name:

```
import {ModuleWithProviders} from '@angular/core';
import * as ngcc0 from './module';

export declare provide(): ModuleWithProviders<ngcc0.Module>;
```

ngtsc now takes this situation into account when reflecting a
`ModuleWithProvider`'s type argument.

Issues.Title: Lazy loading only uses absolute routes
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test

- [ ] add
- [ ] update

- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->
Node: 8.9.3
NPM: 5.5.1
NG:
```
     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 7.1.2
Node: 8.9.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, upgrade

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/core              7.0.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        0.8.8
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.7
@schematics/angular               7.1.2
@schematics/update                0.8.8
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
```

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->
I have this in my base `tsconfig.json` file
```
{
    "compileOnSave": false,
    "compilerOptions": {
        "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
        "baseUrl": "src",
        "sourceMap": true,
        "declaration": false,
        "moduleResolution": "node",
        "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "target": "es5",
        "typeRoots": [
            "node_modules/@types"
        ],
        "lib": [
            "es2016",
            "dom"
        ],
        "noEmit": false,
        "noImplicitAny": false
    }
}
```
I have this in my `tsconfig.app.json`
```
{
    "extends": "../tsconfig.json",
    "compilerOptions": {
        "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
        "module": "es2015",
        "baseUrl": "src",
        "types": [
            "jquery",
            "node"
        ]
    },
    "exclude": [
        "test.ts",
        "**/*.spec.ts",
        "**/*.mock.ts",
        "node_modules",
        "dist"
    ]
}
```
My modules are lazy loaded like this:
```
{
  path: 'projects',
  loadChildren: './modules/projects/projects-hub.module#ProjectsModule'
},
```
Where projects.routing module looks like this:
```
const appRoutes: Routes = [
    {
        path: '',
        component: ProjectsHubComponent,
        canActivate: [AuthenticatedRedirectGuardService, IframeUnloadGuardService]
    }
];

@NgModule({
    imports: [
        RouterModule.forChild(appRoutes)
    ],
    exports: [
        RouterModule
    ]
})
export class ProjectsHubRoutingModule {
}
```
My `angular.json` build configuration for this app looks like this
```
"projects": {
        "my-angular-app": {
            "root": "",
            "sourceRoot": "src",
            "projectType": "application",
            "architect": {
                "build": {
                    "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
                    "options": {
                        "outputPath": "build\\application",
                        "index": "src/index.html",
                        "main": "src/main.ts",
                        "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.app.json",
                        "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts",
                        "assets": [
                            "src/assets",
                            "src/favicon.ico"
                        ],
                        "styles": [
                            "src/styles.css",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.core.css",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.snow.css"
                        ],
                        "scripts": [
                            "node_modules/chart.js/dist/Chart.bundle.min.js",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.js"
                        ]
                    },
                    "configurations": {
                        "production": {
                            "optimization": true,
                            "outputHashing": "none",
                            "sourceMap": false,
                            "extractCss": false,
                            "namedChunks": false,
                            "aot": true,
                            "extractLicenses": true,
                            "vendorChunk": false,
                            "buildOptimizer": true,
                            "fileReplacements": [
                                {
                                    "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts",
                                    "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        "dev": {
                            "optimization": true,
                            "outputHashing": "none",
                            "sourceMap": true,
                            "extractCss": false,
                            "namedChunks": true,
                            "aot": false,
                            "extractLicenses": true,
                            "vendorChunk": false,
                            "buildOptimizer": false
                        }
                    }
                },
```

We put our files on the server in an `/angular/files/dist` folder, in version 5 this used to lazy load things fine from `/angular/files/dist/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js` but now, no amount of changing the `baseHref` in my `angular.json` or changing the `baseUrl` in either of my `tsconfig.json` files will get files to load from here. I have tried setting baseHref/baseUrl to `""`, `"./"`, `"src"`, and even `"/"`, just to see, in all files; but no matter what, they all seem to want to load from `/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js` and produce a 404 for literally every module file. 

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
`GET http://localhost/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js net::ERR_ABORTED 404 (Not Found)`

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->
I would like to lazy load chunks from the relative path of wherever my angular files are actually located. I feel like this is probably possible (as it was in V5) and I have very likely just misconfigured something, but I can't seem to figure it out and am seeking advice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Lazy loading only uses absolute routes" (#13163)

Issues.Title: ng test: Debug with VS Code (Unverified Breakpoint)
Issues.Body: ### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting - [ ] feature request ``` There are similar bugs logged however most of them are outdated(2017) and have been closed ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Versions ```bash > yarn ng --version ``` Angular CLI: 7.1.2 Node: 11.3.0 Yarn: 1.12.3 OS: darwin x64 (Mojave 10.14.1) Angular: 7.1.2 ### Repro steps ```bash > npx @angular/cli@7.1.2 new explorer ``` - Launch VS Code and configure tests for debugging (Refer: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-recipes/tree/master/Angular-CLI#configure-launchjson-file) - ```json { "name": "ng test", "type": "chrome", "request": "launch", "url": "http://localhost:9876/debug.html", "webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}" }, ``` - `yarn test` and Start debugging from VS Code (opens a separate chrome window) - - Breakpoints are not hit (Unverified breakpoint) ### The log given by the failure No logs ### Desired functionality **Breakpoints should be hit inside VSCode**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng test: Debug with VS Code (Unverified Breakpoint)" (#13154)

Issues.Title: lazy loading not working in Angular 4
Issues.Body:
I'm getting this error when try to navigate to 'http://localhost:4200/dashboard' lazy loading route in angualr, angualr-cli 4.1.0

> ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot find 'DashboardModule' in './dashboard/dashboard.module'
Error: Cannot find 'DashboardModule' in './dashboard/dashboard.module'
    at checkNotEmpty (core.es5.js:5939)
    at core.es5.js:5901
    at ZoneDelegate.invoke (zone.js:391)
    at Object.onInvoke (core.es5.js:4149)

    at Zone.run (zone.js:141)

    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:423)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:769)
    at resolvePromise (zone.js:740)

    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:423)
    at Zone.runTask (zone.js:191)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone.js:584)

` export const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: 'login',
    loadChildren: 'app/pages/login/login.module#LoginModule'
  },
  {
    path: 'pages',
    component: Pages,
    canActivate: [LoggedInGuard],
    data : { 
      expectedRole: ['admin']
    },  
    children: [
      { path: '', redirectTo: 'dashboard', pathMatch: 'full' },
      { path: 'orders', loadChildren: './orders/orders.module#OrdersModule' },      
      { path: 'resturant', loadChildren: './resturant/resturant.module#ResturantModule' },      
      { path: 'dashboard', loadChildren: './dashboard/dashboard.module#DashboardModule' },
      { path: 'customers', loadChildren: './customers/cutomer.module#CustomerModule'},
      { path: 'drivers', loadChildren: './drivers/drivers.module#DriverModule'},
      { path:"profileSettings",loadChildren:'./profile/profile.module#ProfileModule'},
      { path:"newDriver",  loadChildren:'./drivers/newDriver/newdriver.module#newDriverModule'}
    ]
  }
];

export const routing: ModuleWithProviders = RouterModule.forChild(routes);`

Issues.Title: Large inaccuracy of recompilation timings using ng serve
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] serve
```

### Versions
Node: v11.4.0
npm: 6.4.1
ng: 7.1.2

OS: Linux Debian 9 x64

### Repro steps

I ran `ng serve --verbose` on my rather large project in an attempt to profile the recompilation time (which I thought was quite long) and the timings for the first recompilation (after making a minor change) does not add up at all:

```
59ms building modules                                                                
14ms finish module graph                            
8ms sealing                                
1ms basic dependencies optimization 
0ms dependencies optimization 
0ms advanced dependencies optimization 
174ms after dependencies optimization
0ms optimizing 
0ms basic module optimization 
153ms module optimization                        
1ms advanced module optimization 
0ms after module optimization 
105ms basic chunk optimization                           
1ms chunk optimization 
30ms advanced chunk optimization                        
0ms after chunk optimization 
0ms module and chunk tree optimization 
0ms after module and chunk tree optimization 
0ms basic chunk modules optimization 
0ms chunk modules optimization 
0ms advanced chunk modules optimization
0ms after chunk modules optimization 
2ms module reviving                 
0ms module order optimization 
0ms advanced module order optimization 
21ms before module ids                   
1ms module ids 
12ms module id optimization
2ms chunk reviving                 
0ms chunk order optimization                               
0ms before chunk ids                   
0ms chunk id optimization 
14ms after chunk id optimization
1ms record modules                 
0ms record chunks                 
72ms hashing
0ms after hashing 
0ms record hash 
2ms module assets processing 
2ms chunk assets processing 
10ms additional chunk assets processing
1ms recording 
0ms additional asset processing                        
0ms chunk asset optimization 
15ms after chunk asset optimization                                                                                     
0ms asset optimization 
0ms after asset optimization 
1ms after seal 
61ms emitting                          
0ms after emitting                  
Hash: e706017df3bcb7dad233
Version: webpack 4.19.1
Time: 5107ms
Built at: 12/09/2018 10:13:50 AM
```

When I add up all those numbers I get 761ms - but the total time it took was 5107ms.

### Desired functionality

I would like for the timings to add up to the total recompilation time, to allow for better profiling of the process.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Large inaccuracy of recompilation timings using ng serve" (#13155)

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->

I have a private project so I am unable to share the repo, so sorry in advance. I have an angular project to which I have added schematics support so I can update it using `ng update`. So I have a schematics folder with a `migration.json` file : 

```
{
  "$schema": "../../../node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/collection-schema.json",

      "description": "Update",
      "factory": "./src/ng-update/index"
    }
  }
}
```

`tsconfig.schematics.json` : 

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es2015",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "declaration": true,
    "sourceMap": true,

      "es2017",
      "esnext.asynciterable"
    ]
  },

    "**/files/*.ts",
    "**/*.spec.ts"
  ]
}
```

`tsconfig.schematics.spec.json` : 

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "module": "commonjs",
    "target": "es2015",
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "types": [
      "jasmine",
      "node"
    ],
    "lib": [
        "es2017",
        "dom"
    ],
    "declaration": false
  },
  "include": [
    "./spec/**/*.spec.ts"
  ]
}
```

`jasmine.json` :  

```
{
  "spec_dir": "projects/nav-menu/schematics/spec",
  "spec_files": [
    "**/*.spec.js"
  ],
  "helpers": [
    "projects/nav-menu/schematics/spec/helpers/**/*.js"
  ],
  "stopSpecOnExpectationFailure": false,
  "random": false
}
```

I have an `ng-update` folder with `index.ts` : 

```
import { Rule, SchematicContext, SchematicsException, Tree } from "@angular-devkit/schematics";

export default function(): Rule {
  return (tree: Tree, context: SchematicContext) => {
    context.logger.warn("it's happening!");

    const pkgPath = "/package.json";
    const buffer = tree.read(pkgPath);
    if (buffer == null) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Could not read package.json");
    }
    const content = buffer.toString();
    const pkg = JSON.parse(content);

    if (pkg === null || typeof pkg !== "object" || Array.isArray(pkg)) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Error reading package.json");
    }

    if (!pkg.dependencies) {
      pkg.dependencies = {};
    }

    if (pkg.dependencies["@solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration"]) {
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-perfect-scrollbar"] = `^7.0.0`;
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-device-detector"] = null;

      tree.overwrite(pkgPath, JSON.stringify(pkg, null, 2));
    }

    return tree;
  };
}
```

`package.json` for my nav menu project : 

```
{
  "name": "@solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration",
  "version": "0.0.1",

  },
  "schematics": "./schematics/collection.json",
  "ng-update": {
    "migrations": "./schematics/migration.json"
  }
}

```

Once I publish my package I try to update `nav-menu` in one of my other application's which use this package. I have tried a number of different commands and non of them seem to run the `migration.json` schematic on `ng update`. So I have tried : 

`ng update @solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration --to=1.0.0-nav-menu-with-migration.3 --migrate-only`

and I get the following error: `Incompatible peer dependencies found. See above` 

 ```
Package "@solarwinds/nova-xui" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/cdk" (requires "6.3.3", would install "6.4.7").

                  Package "@solarwinds/nova-xui" has an incompatible peer dependency to "rxjs" (requires "6.2.2", would install "6.3.3").
Incompatible peer dependencies found. See above.
```
 
So I tried with `--force` flag and I do get my `package.json` file updated but I never see my `migration.json` schematic run. 

`g update @solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration --to=1.0.0-nav-menu-with-migration.3 --force --migrate-only`

```
Package "@solarwinds/nova-xui" has an incompatible peer dependency to "rxjs" (requires "6.2.2", would install "6.3.3").
                  Package "@solarwinds/nova-xui" has an incompatible peer dependency to "@angular/cdk" (requires "6.3.3", would install "6.4.7").

I am not sure why my `ng update` command is not run. Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): set use-host-property-decorator to false in new apps
Issues.Body:
Inspired by [this twitter thread](https://twitter.com/aaronfrost/status/1070389114959097856), this PR changes the default setting for the `use-host-property-decorator` codelyzer rule. 

The rule gives the developer the impression that the `host` property in the `Component` decorator is deprecated, which is not the case. 

In fact, the [angular/material2](https://github.com/angular/material2) project maintained by the Angular team uses it more than 140 times throughout the project.

Personally I've spend a few hours over the years to work around this warning, refactoring `host` properties to `@HostBinding` as I thought it was deprecated. The Twitter thread above thought me it's not, which is why I think it should be disabled.

Here we can see other people [agree on this](https://twitter.com/aaronfrost/status/1070389114959097856), and have been [for a while](https://github.com/angular/angular.io/issues/1763#issuecomment-264036519).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@schematics/angular): set use-host-property-decorator to false in new apps" (#13147)

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.8.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.8.8
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.8.8

@schematics/update                 0.8.7
ng-packagr                         4.4.0
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         2.7.2
webpack                            4.16.4

Windows 10

### Repro steps
git clone https://github.com/Aphax/angular6-lib-lazy-submodule

```
cd angular6-lib-lazy-submodule
ng build admin
npm run start
```

### The log given by the failure
`ERROR in Could not resolve module ./users/users.module relative to /C/Workspace/angular6-libtest/dist/admin/admin.d.ts`

### Desired functionality
It should be possible to have nested lazy modules without any error output on ng serve.


### Mention any other details that might be useful
It seems that admin.d.ts tries to resolve paths of lazy routes, the problem is that its position within the folder structure is different than the routing module in the source folders. (one level above out of lib/ folder).

Why admin.d.ts isn't put in lib/ folder instead ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng serve error when loading a lazy module that holds itself lazy routed submodules" (#13142)

```

### Desired functionality
We should be able to run an app with a lazy routed module that has itself lazy routed submodules.

### Mention any other details that might be useful
The error occurs because `admin.d.ts` tries to resolve lazy routes of the module but is one level above in the dist/ hierarchy than the admin-routing.module that declares the routes initially. 
The file `admin.d.ts` should be in the lib/ folder so it would work.

Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```

```

### Versions
<!--
Angular CLI: 7.0.7
Node: 10.10.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/core              7.0.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.0.7
@angular/cli                      7.0.7
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.7
@schematics/angular               7.0.7
@schematics/update                0.10.7
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
node `v10.10.0`, npm `6.4.1`, ng ``
macOS High Sierra
-->

### Desired functionality/Repro/other details that might be useful
I would like to be able to follow the testing guide when using the new angular 7:
https://angular.io/guide/testing#configure-cli-for-ci-testing-in-chrome

But similar to as mentioned in now closed issue #11582 these docs on testing at angular.io still mention/instruct the public to use the `--browser option` instead of the new `--browsers`. And also the --single-run option, which I understand should now be `--watch=false`

So this instruction:
>`ng test --single-run --no-progress --browser=ChromeHeadlessCI`

Should now be:
>`ng test --watch=false --no-progress --browsers=ChromeHeadlessCI`

The next line in the docs source mentions also returns two now missing cli options in the current ng cli 7.0.7 that I'm using:
>`ng e2e --no-progress --config=protractor-ci.conf.js`

returns:
`Unknown option: '--no-progress'`
`Unknown option: '--config'`

Can you fix the docs or the CLI to be consistent. And as workaround perhaps specify alternative for the last two options of `ng test`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng test options mentioned in testing docs don't work" (#13137)

-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.6

@schematics/angular               7.0.6
@schematics/update                0.11.0
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.23.1
```

Os: MacOSX Mojave

### Repro steps

Use enum inside a file like this: 

```
export enum ErrorCode {
    SERVERSIDE_VALIDATION_ERROR_KEY = 'serverside_validation_error',
    ENTITY_NOT_EXISTENT_ERROR_KEY = 'entity_not_existent_error',
    DEPENDENT_ENTITY_ERROR_KEY = 'dependent_entity_error',
    DUPLICATE_ERROR_KEY = 'duplicate_error',
  }

export default class Utils {
```

Import the enum like this:

```
import {Component} from '@angular/core';
import Utils, {ErrorCode} from "../utils";

@Component({
  selector: 'adresse',
  templateUrl: './adresse.component.html'
})
export class AdresseComponent {

  constructor() {
  }

  get errorCodes() {
    return ErrorCode
  }
}
```

Then run: `ng build --prod`

The issue seems to be related to #10655 but this time setting buildOptimzier and optimisation in angular.json to false does not resolve the issue.

Turning off Ahead of Time compilation seems to help for now.

### The log given by the failure

```
ReferenceError: Can't find variable: ErrorCode
get ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:215914
(anonyme Funktion) ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:215882:4327

callViewAction ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:70357
execComponentViewsAction ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:70299
checkAndUpdateView ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:70122
callViewAction ‚Äî main.95f4ea6bc507b9cafd32.js:70357
```
### Desired functionality

That it finds the Enums.

Issues.Title: build: saucelabs verbose logging
Issues.Body:
* In order to be able to observe stability of Saucelabs, I want to see the verbose output immediately instead of deferred.

**Note**: Currently looking why the API rate limit even fails while being authenticated. Not to mix up with the actual browser rate limit ([read more](https://wiki.saucelabs.com/display/DOCS/Rate+Limits+for+the+Sauce+Labs+REST+API))
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: saucelabs verbose logging" (#14454)

Issues.Title: Additional interactive elements in matSort header cell in Mozilla Firefox
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
I want to create some UI elements inside sort-header cell and want them to be available. Now it works fine in Chrome and Edge.

#### What is the current behavior?
The problem is that all content inside heading cell with sorting is wrapped into button
`src/lib/sort/sort-header.html`
```  
  <button class="mat-sort-header-button" type="button"
          [attr.disabled]="_isDisabled() || null"
          [attr.aria-label]="_intl.sortButtonLabel(id)"
          (focus)="_setIndicatorHintVisible(true)"
          (blur)="_setIndicatorHintVisible(false)">
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </button>
```
But in Firefox clicking any children elements won't work because it is nested inside a button. See [issue on StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26402033/missing-click-event-for-span-inside-button-element-on-firefox).

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Open [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vxvnu1) and try clicking red button. 
Chrome, Edge - you'll have alert message.
Mozilla Firefox - no messages.


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Any Mozilla Firefox.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
My suggestion is to use `<a href="#">` instead of `button`. Then behaviour would be the same in every browser. Using of `a` tag is not such nice as `div`, but it allows to keep tab-navigation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Additional interactive elements in matSort header cell in Mozilla Firefox" (#14456)

Issues.Title: MatTable renderRows not working when sorting is used
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? Adding data to the dataSource and calling renderRows() should make the new data appear in the table. #### What is the current behavior? When mat-table sorting is used, renderRows doesnt add the new data in the table. #### What are the steps to reproduce? This is the sorting example from the doc. I added a button to add data to the dataSource. StackBlitz starter: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tverea
This same example is working if we remove the sorting: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hyew7w-sjrovr?file=app%2Ftable-sorting-example.ts #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MatTable renderRows not working when sorting is used" (#14451)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): adding aria-activedescendant while closed if autoActiveFirstOption is enabled
Issues.Body:
Fixes the autocomplete trigger setting its `aria-activedescendant` attribute while the panel is closed and the options aren't in the DOM, if the `autoActiveFirstOption` is enabled.

Fixes #14453.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): adding aria-activedescendant while closed if autoActiveFirstOption is enabled" (#14455)

Issues.Title: mat-autocomplete autoActiveFirstOption sets aria-activedescendant when the autocomplete panel is closed
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When the autocomplete panel is closed and autocomplete is autoActiveFirstOption enabled, the input should not have an aria-activedescendent attribute associated to it.

#### What is the current behavior?
With autoActiveFirstOption attribute added to mat-autocomplete, even when the panel is closed the autocomplete input has aria-activedescendant="[first-mat-option]"

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nsonvp
1. Focus into the autocomplete input.
2. Blur away from the autocomplete input. 
3. inspect the input, you should see aria-activedescendant="mat-option-0"  on the input element.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
"@angular/material": "7.1.1"
"@angular/core": "7.1.2"
"@angular/cdk": "7.1.1"
"@angular/cli": "~7.0.2"

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-autocomplete autoActiveFirstOption sets aria-activedescendant when the autocomplete panel is closed " (#14453)

Issues.Title: build: run api golden checks in separate ci job
Issues.Body: As discussed per chat, we want to show the API golden checks in a separate CI job.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: run api golden checks in separate ci job" (#14452)

Issues.Title: chore(schematics): better NgModule search logic
Issues.Body:
* Similarly to https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/12636#discussion_r209788320, I want to improve the logic for finding `NgModule` declarations within a source file by using BFS.

Probably a micro-optimization because app module files aren't often nested that much, but since I saw this today and remembered of @jelbourn's comment about BFS, I just wanted to improve this real quick.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore(schematics): better NgModule search logic" (#14449)

Issues.Title: build: staging script should switch to publish branch
Issues.Body: * Rather than throwing an exception if an unexpected branch is currently checked out, we should just try switching to the expected publish branch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: staging script should switch to publish branch" (#14448)

Issues.Title: chore(schematics): cleanup temporary directory after test case run
Issues.Body: * Currently we run _multiple_ test cases for the schematics and create temporary directories in order to test them with TSLint. This pollutes the temporary directory because we don't remove the temporary directory afterwards.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore(schematics): cleanup temporary directory after test case run" (#14447)

Issues.Title: fix(schematics): drag-drop schematic two consecutive commas

Issues.Title: Mat-chip disappears on hover
Issues.Body:

Hovering over remove icon and back to mat-chip makes mat-chip invisible.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Mat-chip will be visible under all cimcurstances.

#### What is the current behavior?
Mat-chip blinks and sometimes it visually disappears.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Hover over remove icon and then hover over mat-chip.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

![mat-chip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34771265/49743190-86b56c80-fc9a-11e8-98b6-ba098eeb6017.png)

Issues.Title: mat-select resizes after opening (Edge)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The select opens smoothly

#### What is the current behavior?
The select makes additional resize after the end of animation

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1) open Edge browser
2) go to https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview#getting-and-setting-the-select-value
3) open any select

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular Material v7.1.1
Angular v7.1.1
OS Windows 10

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I think a reason may be in combination of
min-width: calc(32px + 100%) and transform translate on an element div.ng-trigger
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select resizes after opening (Edge)" (#14444)

Issues.Title: [IE Only] Previously focused element is scrolled to top when restored after MatDialog closing
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Scroll is prevented on element restore focus

#### What is the current behavior?
Element's parent is scrolled to top in IE

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-aewevn
2. Press on Click me! button
3. Close dialog by Esc
BUG: button's parent is scrolled to top

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.1.2
Browsers: IE Only

#### Is there anything else we should know?
method MatDialogContainer._restoreFocus contains:
`            toFocus.focus();`
proposed fix:
```
   if (toFocus.setActive) {
        toFocus.setActive(); // IE/Edge
    } else {
        toFocus.focus(); // All other browsers
    }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[IE Only] Previously focused element is scrolled to top when restored after MatDialog closing" (#14443)

Issues.Title: @.disabled binding; mat-tab-group memory leak
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
After the component (with mat-tab-group and bindings) has been destroyed, it should be garbage collected and not leave any memory leaks.

#### What is the current behavior?
We are using material v2 and I noticed that using [@.disabled]="true" with mat-tab-group causes memory leaks. @HostBinding('@.disabled') was fine, no leaks.
However, it appears versions 5, 6 and 7 are even worse, both variants cause memory leaks, and even just the mat-tabs-group component itself.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Use the actual link in a new tab to access the DevTools.
versions:
2 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-2-et-disabled-leak
5 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-5-et-disabled-leak
6 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-6-et-disabled-leak
7 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-7-et-disabled-leak

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 4, 5, 6, 7; Angular Material 2, 5, 6, 7
Windows 10, Chrome 70, Typescript 3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Possibly related: 
- [#18606](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/18606)
- [#24197](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24197)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@.disabled binding; mat-tab-group memory leak" (#14442)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete "closeOnSelect"
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Proposal to add "closeOnSelect: boolean" property.

#### What is the expected behavior?
- User selects an option
- List does not close

#### What is the current behavior?
- User selects an option
- List is closed automatically

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples
Here is example "Chips autocomplete"
When user selects many items sometimes auto select closing is not useful.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Last version

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Package select2 provided property "closeOnSelect"
@ng-select provided this option also
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autocomplete "closeOnSelect"" (#14441)

Issues.Title: [MatMenu] MatMenuTrigger ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError aria-expanded: null
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Error should not occur

#### What is the current behavior?
Repeatedly and quickly clicking on menu trigger button causes error

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-stgyux)
Click on menuTrigger repeatedly -> error shows in console


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.1.0
Angular Material 7.1.0
Chrome Browser

#### Is there anything else we should know?
ChangeDetection: OnPush

ERROR
Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'aria-expanded: true'. Current value: 'aria-expanded: null'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[MatMenu] MatMenuTrigger ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError aria-expanded: null" (#14440)

Issues.Title: Drag Drop- apply class to all linked drop lists
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
A class that is applied to all linked drop lists once an item starts dragging

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Currently cdk-drop-list-dragging is only applied to a cdkdroplist once a dropppable item is moved over it, it would be useful to be able to style all potential drop lists as a guide for where items may be dropped.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag Drop- apply class to all linked drop lists" (#14439)

Issues.Title: docs(drag-drop): add docs and live example for boundary functionality
Issues.Body:
Adds a live example and some docs for the new `cdkDragBoundary` input.

**Note:** targeting `minor` since the new input will be released in the next minor version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(drag-drop): add docs and live example for boundary functionality" (#14438)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): add service for attaching drag&drop to arbitrary DOM nodes
Issues.Body:
* Adds the  `DragDrop` service that simplifies the construction logic for `DragRef` and `DropListRef` and allows consumers to attach drag&drop functionality to arbitrary DOM nodes, rather than having to go through the directives.
* Reworks `DragRef` and `DragDropRef` to make them easier to construct.
* Normalizes some of the instances where some parameters only accept an `ElementRef`, whereas others accept `ElementRef | HTMLElement`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(drag-drop): add service for attaching drag&drop to arbitrary DOM nodes" (#14437)

Issues.Title: chore: add landmark elements to dev app
Issues.Body: Fixes the dev app not having landmark elements. This removes some of the noise when doing accessibility checks with aXe.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore: add landmark elements to dev app" (#14436)

Issues.Title: fix(tooltip): not closing if escape is pressed while trigger isn't focused
Issues.Body:
Currently the tooltip's `keydown` handler is on the trigger, which means that it won't fire if the trigger doesn't have focus. This could happen when a tooltip was opened by hovering over the trigger. These changes use the `OverlayKeyboardDispatcher` to handle the events instead.

Fixes #14278.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(tooltip): not closing if escape is pressed while trigger isn't focused" (#14434)

Issues.Title: build: only stamp build builds in release mode
Issues.Body: * No longer runs the `workspace_status_command` for normal Bazel builds. This should speed up builds by about ~8 seconds init phase.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: only stamp build builds in release mode" (#14431)

Issues.Title: feat(select): add alternate rendering strategy for improved accessibility
Issues.Body:
Currently `mat-select` has some accessibility issues, because we don't keep the options in the DOM until the select is attached, making it harder for assistive technology to pick it up. These changes add an alternate, opt-in, rendering strategy that'll keep the options inside the DOM. The rendering strategy is controlled through the `MAT_SELECT_RENDERING_STRATEGY` injection token.

In order to facilitate the new rendering strategy, these changes introduce a new kind of portal called an `InlinePortal`. It is a portal whose content is transferred from one place in the DOM to another when it is attached/detached.

Another change that was necessary for the new rendering to work was being able to pass a portal to the `CdkConnectedOverlay` directive. If no portal is passed, the directive will fall back to the current behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(select): add alternate rendering strategy for improved accessibility" (#14430)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): add footer with close button for screen readers
Issues.Body:
Users with screen readers have difficulty closing the datepicker popup
obviously because they would have a hard time tapping the backdrop.
Also, on mobile device screen readers they do not have an escape key.

![datepickera11yclosedemo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28766663/49682568-64e29c80-fa84-11e8-9fa4-e12af6e4888b.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): add footer with close button for screen readers" (#14429)

Issues.Title: ionic 4 with MatFormField appearance="outline"
Issues.Body:
I'm using IONIC 4 and copy an example

`<mat-form-field appearance="outline">
    <mat-label>Outline form field</mat-label>
    <input matInput placeholder="Placeholder">
    <mat-icon matSuffix>sentiment_very_satisfied</mat-icon>
    <mat-hint>Hint</mat-hint>
  </mat-form-field>`

and when label floating, it's not overflow: 

[http://oi65.tinypic.com/33uqtqo.jpg](http://oi65.tinypic.com/33uqtqo.jpg)


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.1.2
Material 7.1.1
Latest iOS, macOS
TypeScript 3.1.6
Browsers: Safari, Chrome, Firefox

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ionic 4 with MatFormField appearance="outline"" (#14428)
